description: So many sofas at the design fair in Milan, yet no place to sit. Marni’s solution? A courtyard oasis in front of its shop at Via Spiga 50.
title: Garden Shop | Marni
title_page: For a Shop in Milan, Its Own Garden of Eden
text:
Courtesy of Marni
The Salone del Mobile design fair in Milan starts this week, and every year it’s a similar story: chairs and sofas as far as the eye can see and yet not so many places to sit and relax. In a nod to the once-abundant greenery in this city, Marni has installed a courtyard oasis in front of its shop at Via Spiga 50.
“We wanted to pay tribute to Italian flora and encourage the return of plants to our urban centers,” said Consuelo Castiglioni, the label’s designer, about the lavender, kitchen herbs and mulberry bushes that replaced the camellia trees that typically decorate the space.
And even if the skies are gray this week, Marni has guaranteed spring: the artist Sara Rossi’s vernal film “Laterna Magica” will be projected on the walls.
